title: How to Make Irish Coffee for St. Patrick's Day

steps.headline: Put 12 tablespoons of coffee grounds in your coffee maker.
steps.description: (If you are a beginner: Read the instruction manual to assure that the coffee is brewed properly--you don't want to ruin the coffee maker!)

steps.headline: Pour 12 cups of water into the coffee maker.
steps.description: Start brewing the coffee while you prep the other ingredients.

steps.headline: Take an Irish Coffee mug and put 1-2 Tbs.
steps.description: of Irish Cream flavored creamer in the cup. Then, pour 1-2 Tbs. of Peppermint Mocha creamer into the cup. Stir the creamers together.

steps.headline: Fill the cup with coffee.
steps.description: Stop pouring when the coffee gets about an inch away from the rim of the mug.

steps.headline: Fill the rest of the cup with whipped cream.
steps.description: You will want to make swirls with the whipped cream, so it is "stacked" on top of itself in swirls.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the green sprinkles on top of the whipped cream.
Stick 4 lucky clovers on top of the whipped cream and sprinkles.
steps.description: Make all the stems touch so that there are four leaves on each clover, 4 clovers to each cup of Irish Coffee.

text: Put 12 tablespoons of coffee grounds in your coffee maker. (If you are a beginner: Read the instruction manual to assure that the coffee is brewed properly--you don't want to ruin the coffee maker!) Pour 12 cups of water into the coffee maker. Start brewing the coffee while you prep the other ingredients. Take an Irish Coffee mug and put 1-2 Tbs. of Irish Cream flavored creamer in the cup. Then, pour 1-2 Tbs. of Peppermint Mocha creamer into the cup. Stir the creamers together. Fill the cup with coffee. Stop pouring when the coffee gets about an inch away from the rim of the mug. Fill the rest of the cup with whipped cream. You will want to make swirls with the whipped cream, so it is "stacked" on top of itself in swirls. Sprinkle the green sprinkles on top of the whipped cream. Make a thin layer. Stick 4 lucky clovers on top of the whipped cream and sprinkles. Make all the stems touch so that there are four leaves on each clover, 4 clovers to each cup of Irish Coffee. Enjoy your Irish Coffee!
